title: Looking for Mercator sans serif designed by Dick Dooijes for Amsterdam (1957-61)
content:
Can anyone tell me where I can get a digital copy of - Mercator Sans Serif?

 [‹ (x) Drammen logo - ITC Serif Gothic (customised) {Martin L'Allier}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054818/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31261 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) LiveWire Brush Script-like MySpace background - Brush Script {Lari} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054818/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31252 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Diarmuid

comments.content: Only Mercator I know is [this design](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054818/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.100872.0.0) by [Arthur Baker](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054818/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Arthur%252BBaker), and it’s certainly no sans serif.
Mercator is very Ludovico degli Arrighi-ish (to my eye), broadpen script with swashes, very calligraphic. Perhaps you’re thinking of Mentor or Mercury?

Diarmuid, do you have a sample of this font?

- Mike Yanega
Mercator was a type designed by Dick Dooijes for Amsterdam (1957-61). It has a nice Q. Dont know about a digital one. And yes, it was sans serif :)

Indeed. It’s shown in ’Dutch Type’, the excellent book by Jan Middendorp.

- Mike Yanega
I’ve been looking for this typeface for ages, myself — let us know if you find anything...

I didn’t see it on the Dutch Type Library Site [http://www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054818/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/ "http://www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/")

But in my own collection - I have a Mercator from 1994 - put out by Brenel Informatik GMBH — and it looks like a cross between Eden and Glamour - leaning more towards Eden...

A sample of which Mercator “Sans” would be most helpful.
